messages.text: It should be able to play any hvrs file, although it does have memory constraints
so we have our web player playing hvrses that are labelled web600*.hvrs. any idea if should be able to play other ones?
don't worry: that was something I introduced :smile:
Not really sure. In a meeting now, but will take a look afterwards
hmm any idea why assets in the web player would appear at a lower-resolution than they actually are?
Cool
OK I'll give it a go
but possibly still quite old
It should be more up to date than develop
do you reckon I use the `player` branch for the `src/eighti` code (that gets turned into eighti.min.js)?
Cheers
anything inside the compiled JS, he knows best about.
<@U03DPGB9Y>
Who was the guy I should ask about the web player?
sweet
but the file in the repo is <https://github.com/8i/WebPlatform/blob/develop/tests/teamcity/index.html>
You might just be able to include them using absolute urls
otherwise i'll have to copy all the dependencies out too from that page
yup. is there a repo on github for it?
basically does some setup and then eventually calls loadScene with a json blob containing an hvrs url.
Its just in a <script> tag on that page
when you said 'copy the javascript' did you mean from the site you linked? is it on github?
Sweet
But yea, have a stab at that. Let me know if you need any assistance.
The actual code which makes the network request for the hvrs is C++ compiled into JS so I’m not really sure about the complexity of adding any auth headers etc.
If you include all those sources and then copy the javascript you should be able to play any public hvrs url
nice. do you reckon just extract what we want from the code of that?
That is probably the most barebones integration of an hvrs
We have this page, which was exposed for testing new builds of the web player. <https://web-stage.dev.8i.com/teamCity>
Actually I don’t know if HVR files are supported currently, I’ve only ever used HVRS files so far in the web player.
I guess we'd want some kind of front-end dependency that can play HVR/S. Maybe CORS won't be an issue since all the sites are under <http://8i.com|8i.com> (?)
I’m not entirely sure what solution would best fit the needs of the farm team, and don’t really know much about the current tech stack for farm/studio.
Obviously we have a web player which can play hvrs files, but the current version doesn’t really deal with anything like cross origin or authentication or anything like that.
So that idea has been brought up in the past but never really gone anywhere.
Hey

Hey man. We in the farm team are interested in viewing HVRs and HVRSs in our farm websites (e.g. <https://8iwlgtest-sydney-farm1.devfarms.8i.com/>) to help debugging for pipeline people. How difficult do you think this might be?
